lines.text:
[about to take the photograph]
Everybody howl.
That's a cop-out... nothing is explained.
In 1278, fear and oppression gripped Outer Mongolia where the peasantry grovelled under the bloody heel of Irving the Horrible...
This story has nothing to do with Irving, we just thought you might be interested.
Go mong your fish someplace else!
What the hell. I can always get a distemper shot.

[Opening the door to the motel room]
After you, my dear.

[Entering the room]
A motel room... How utterly American.

[chuckling seductively]
I've heard what goes on in these places.
It's what comes off that counts.

[as US Navy theme song "Anchors Aweigh" plays]
Our grateful acknowledgement to the United States Navy who wanted nothing to do with this picture - but reluctantly lent us their song.
